intro: Luzula hyperborea var. major, commonly known as the alpine woodrush, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to high-altitude regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It belongs to the family Poaceae, commonly referred to as grasses, and is characterized by its dense, tufted growth habit. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, greenish to brownish flowers. It thrives in cool, moist environments, often found in alpine tundra and rocky slopes. Luzula hyperborea var. major is notable for its ability to survive in harsh climates, showcasing adaptations to extreme environmental conditions.
